page.title: 03THAMES-SIDE FORTS
page.content: In this particular area three forts were established in the eighteenth century to defend the river approaches to London but these are now disused and most are in disrepair. The three forts together formed the first line of defence. They were subsequently strengthened in the 1860's. One,{ {Shornemead Fort},in Kent,was still used as a defence post in the First and Second World Wars in this century. Now only part of the structure remains but the facade gives an impression of completeness.{Cliffe Fort}is in a bad state of repair and is fenced off from the public. The{Coalhouse Fort}in Essex is being refurbished by Thurrock Council;a small Aircraft Museum has been established there and the fort is surrounded by an attractive public park which includes a boating pool.
